dict.acceptation: 关键性的，极其显要的；决定性的；十字形的；

sent.orig: Turning agents into double agents instead of hanging them has two crucial advantages.
sent.trans: 不把间谍处死，而是把他们转变为双重间谍可以得到两个非常大的好处。

sent.orig: The election comes at a crucial juncture in Hong Kong's post-colonial development.
sent.trans: 本次选举正赶上香港后殖民时代发展的关键点。

sent.orig: Tail feathers are crucial to birds.
sent.trans: 尾羽对鸟类来说，具有至关重要的作用。

sent.orig: Adaptation is crucial to the development of the children and adolescents.
sent.trans: 适应是儿童和青少年发展的中心问题。

sent.orig: Piling deviation has always been crucial for quality control of pile foundation engineering of piled wharves.
sent.trans: 高桩梁板式码头桩基施工中，桩的偏位问题始终是桩基工程质量控制的重点。
